data.title: Best Buddies in Virginia & DC
data.meta_description:
Best Buddies in Virginia & DC | 824 followers on LinkedIn. Friendship, Jobs, Leadership Development & Inclusive Living for people with intellectual and developmental disabilities. | Best Buddies is a nonprofit 501(c)(3) organization dedicated to establishing a global volunteer movement that creates opportunities for one-to-one friendships, integrated employment, leadership development, and inclusive living for people with intellectual and developmental disabilities.  

Founded in 1989 by Anthony K. Shriver, Best Buddies is a vibrant, international organization that has grown from one original chapter to almost 1,500 middle school, high school, and college chapters worldwide.

Happy #TransitionsTuesday! Last week, 9 students joined Best Buddies in Virginia & DC Manager of Transitions Erin Ijzer for a Transitions Workshop. Students learned skills in positive self-talk, self-advocacy, how to present an elevator pitch, and what you want to include in a resume. Topics covered vocational interests, SMART goals, and independent living. "A fun fact about me is that I have a twin". These students had a great time engaging with the content covered in the Transitions workshop with Best Buddies! "I loved learning how to give an elevator pitch and having the opportunity to present my pitch to my peers" said one twin. "I really enjoyed learning about what my options are after high school - I didn't know there were so many!" said the other twin. The Best Buddies Transitions Program aims to support students as they explore their next steps after high school. Are you interested in attending other Transitions workshops? Contact Manager of Transitions, Erin Ijzer at erinijzer@bestbuddies.org.

Thank you to our rock star employer partner, Navy Federal Credit Union, for donating water bottles, notebooks, pens, and more to our students attending the #BestBuddiesLeadershipConference at Indiana University Bloomington this week! Terrence and adam giere welcomed Caroline Fleury and Samaria Dellorso to the Navy Federal Credit Union Federal office and helped pack the goodie bags. In true #TeamNavyFederal fashion, they went above and beyond and shipped all the welcome bags to Indiana University. Navy Federal Credit Union began its partnership with Best Buddies in Virginia & DC as an inclusive workplace and is looking forward to hiring more Best Buddies job participants! They've also hosted many tabling events for their employees to learn about Best Buddies and get involved, and they printed signs for our Friendship Walks. Thank you, Navy Federal Credit Union! Your constant support makes the world of a difference! Are you interested in becoming an inclusive workplace? Email our Director of Programs and Operations, Caroline Fleury, at CarolineFleury@BestBuddies.org #InclusiveWorkplace #Gratitude #BBLC #BBLC2024

We are deeply saddened to hear about the passing of our dear friend, Chef Robert Curtis. Chef Robert was a champion of inclusion and a long-time supporter of Best Buddies' mission to make our community a more inclusive space. He served as one of our Chefs for our 2022 and 2023 Homecoming Galas, where he shared his unparalleled culinary talent with our guests. During these Galas, Chef Robert worked with two of our participants with intellectual and developmental disabilities as his sous chefs, AC and Erin. Chef Robert welcomed AC and Erin into his kitchens and showed them the ropes of serving incredible food for everyone to enjoy. His kindness and warmth radiated through his work and were seen and felt by our Best Buddies community, staff, and everyone who had the pleasure of knowing him. He will be missed dearly by our Best Buddies community and beyond. We extend our condolences to Chef Robertâ€™s family, friends, and peers during this time. To learn more about Chef Robertâ€™s work with Best Buddies, visit our linktree: Linktr.ee/bestbuddiesvadc

We welcomed two new Employment Consultants in June 2024 and we are so excited for them to start working with our Jobs participants and making our communities' workplaces more inclusive! ğŸ’¼ Meet Samaria! Hi! My name is Samaria and I could not be more excited to start my position as an Employment Consultant with Best Buddies VA/DC! Having previously started a high school friendship chapter in this region, I have seen first hand how impactful Best Buddies is for people both with and without IDDs, and I am looking forward to ensuring equity, access, and inclusion in the work force through my new role. Some more about me! I recently graduated from Brandeis University in Massachusetts - I am so happy to be back in my old stomping grounds, but I am certainly already missing the Red Sox, the Charles River, and the Boston Commons. In my free time I love to read, binge watch TV shows (currently tackling Grey's Anatomy and the newest season of The Bear), play the various NYT games, and go for long walks with friends. I am so happy to be a part of this team and organization! ğŸ’¼ Meet Molly! Hello everyone! My name is Molly, and I am very excited to join the team here at Best Buddies in DC. What drew me to Best Buddies was their commitment to fostering inclusion and unity among individuals with and without IDD. As an Employment Consultant, I am eager to contribute to this mission by assisting others in achieving their professional goals. A little about myself: I am from Charleston, SC, and recently graduated from Clemson University. During my time at Clemson, I volunteered with ClemsonLIFE and YoungLife Capernaum. In my downtime, you can often find me enjoying the company of friends and family, soaking up the sun at the beach, walking my dogs, or tuning into my favorite podcasts.
